sect1.title: Using Cassandra for Workunit Storage
sect1.para: Beginning with version 6.0.0, you can configure your system to use Apache Cassandra database for Workunit storage. Apache’s Cassandra NoSQL data store is a software framework that supports data-intensive distributed applications under a free license.
The default HPCC configuration continues to be the same--Workunits are stored in Dali’s data store and Sasha is typically configured to archive workunits to disk to save memory usage.
Switching to Cassandra Workunit storage eliminates the need to archive workunits and allows you to manage your data independently.
This section details the steps to configure your HPCC platform to use Cassandra as a Workunit server.

row.entry: Storing in Dali requires no additional software or work
Must install and configure a Cassandra server
Requires its own housekeeping and maintenance
Archived Workunits are harder to access, must be restored before results can be seen
No need to archive so all Workunits can remain "Live"
Single backup of data supported. Manual Fail over
Inherent fault tolerance with data replication, designed for high availability.

listitem.para: Install Cassandra and configure it as you wish. The only requirements to work with an HPCC platform are:
Create a keyspace to use for Workunit Storage in Cassandra. The default is hpcc.

If you want security, you should set up Cassandra’s authentication and create a superuser for HPCC to use. These credentials must then be entered in the DaliPlugin configuration in Configuration Manager.
Ensure your Cassandra server can be reached by your HPCC nodes. (listen_address and rpc_address)
Know your Cassandra settings (IP, Port, keyspace, user credentials, etc.)
Use Configuration Manager to configure your HPCC platform to use Cassandra for Workunit storage.
Make sure Cassandra is running.
Once you have configured your HPCC Platform to use Cassandra for Workunit storage, you must make sure Cassandra is running before starting your system.
Push out your environment.xml and restart your HPCC Platform.
If you have existing Workunits, export them from Dali and import them into Cassandra using wutool.
If you have existing archived Workunits, and you want them active, import them into Cassandra.
Once Workunits are stored in a Cassandra Workunit store, Sasha will no longer archive Workunits (despite any settings it may have).
Any previously archived Workunits will remain in storage on the Sasha server and will continue to be available in the same manner they have been.

sect2.title: Configure your HPCC platform to use Cassandra for Workunit storage
sect2.para: This option is configured by adding a DaliPlugin component to your system.

sect3.title: Connect to Configuration Manager
sect3.para: In order to change the configuration for HPCC components, connect to the Configuration Manager.

listitem.para: Stop all HPCC Components, if they are running.
Verify that they are stopped. You can use a single command, such as : sudo /opt/HPCCSystems/sbin/hpcc-run.sh -a hpcc-init status
Start Configuration Manager.
Connect your web browser to the Configuration Manager web interface.
(using the url of http://<configmgr_IP_Address>:8015, where <configmgr_IP_Address> is the IP address of the node running Configuration Manager)
Select the Advanced View radio button.

Use the drop list to select the XML configuration file.
Note:
Configuration Manager never works on the active configuration file. After you finish editing you will have to copy the environment.xml to the active location and push it out to all nodes.
Check the Write Access box.
Default access is read-only. Many options are only available when write-access is enabled.

sect3.title: Adding the DaliServerPlugin component
sect3.para: The DaliServerPlugin controls your Cassandra Workunit storage options.

listitem.para: Right-click on Navigator Pane and choose New Components from the pop-up menu, then choose DaliServerPlugin from the pop-up menu.
Fill in the DaliServerPlugin properties:
Fill in the Attributes tab with the appropriate settings for your existing Cassandra Server.
Add options on the Options tab.
User and password are only needed if your Cassandra server is configured to require credentials.
Click on the disk icon to save.
Copy the new xml file from the source directory to the /etc/HPCCSystems and rename the file to environment.xml

row.entry: Make sure that you have sufficient privileges to write file(s) to the destination directory before attempting to copy. If prompted to overwrite the destination file, you should answer yes.

listitem.para: Copy the /etc/HPCCSystems/environment.xml to /etc/HPCCSystems/ on every node.
You may want to create a script to push out the XML file to all nodes. A sample script is provided with HPCC. The following command copies the XML files out to all nodes as required:
Restart the HPCC system on every node.

sect2.para: The wutool is a command line utility used to maintain your Workunit store. It can be found in /opt/HPCCSystems/bin/ on any server where the platform has been installed. You can use this utility to export your Workunits from a Dali server and then import into a Cassandra data store. You can also use it to import archived workunits on a Sasha server.

row.entry:
Archive specified Workunits to xml files. The following options are supported:
[TO=<directory>]
[DEL=1]
[DELETERESULTS=1]
[INCLUDEFILES=1]
Delete workunits older than NN days
Check contents of workunit repository for errors. [FIX=1] will try to repair any issues found.
Delete entire workunit repository (requires entire=1 repository=1)

sect2.para: <workunits> can be specified on the command line or can be specified using a filter owner=XXXX. If omitted, all workunits are selected.

Options
(These options are valid if CASSANDRASERVER is specified)
CASSANDRA_KEYSPACE
Cassandra keyspace. default is hpcc.
CASSANDRA_USER
Cassandra username to use (if needed).
CASSANDRA_PASSWORD
Cassandra password to use (if needed).
TRACELEVEL
Trace level (1-10)
Examples:

para.programlisting:
/opt/HPCCSystems/bin/wutool archive DALISERVER=. del=1
/opt/HPCCSystems/bin/wutool restore *.xml CASSANDRASERVER=192.168.56.120 CASSANDRA_KEYSPACE=hpcc2
